intro: Anhalonium pulvilligerum, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a unique member of the Anhalonium genus within the family Asparagaceae. It is a succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves that give it a ghostly appearance. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, it is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or white in color. Due to its low water requirements and striking appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in collections of succulents.
